meanings.definition: The quality or state of being factual.
meanings.sent1: The factuality of the report was unquestionable.
meanings.sent2: She always valued factuality in her research.
meanings.sent3: The factuality of the weather forecast made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His storytelling had a touch of factuality that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The factuality of the historical documents brought the past to life.

meanings.definition: The truth or reality of a situation or statement.
meanings.sent1: The factuality of his words was evident to all.
meanings.sent2: In court, proving factuality is crucial.
meanings.sent3: The factuality of the gossip was surprisingly accurate.
meanings.sent4: The factuality of her emotions shone through her words.
meanings.sent5: The factuality of the situation hit him like a ton of bricks.
